001package com.technototes.library.hardware.motor;
002
003import com.qualcomm.robotcore.hardware.DcMotor;
004import com.qualcomm.robotcore.hardware.DcMotorSimple;
005import com.qualcomm.robotcore.util.Range;
006import com.technototes.library.hardware.HardwareDevice;
007import java.util.function.Supplier;
008
009/**
010 * Class for motors
011 *
012 * @param <T> The qualcomm hardware device interface
013 * @author Alex Stedman
014 */
015@SuppressWarnings("unused")
016public class Motor<T extends DcMotorSimple> extends HardwareDevice<T> implements Supplier<Double> {
017
018    private double min = -1, max = 1;
019    protected double power;
020    protected DcMotorSimple.Direction dir;
021    protected DcMotor.ZeroPowerBehavior zeroBehavior;
022
023    private String dirStr() {
024        return dir == DcMotorSimple.Direction.FORWARD ? "Fwd" : "Rev";
025    }
026
027    private String zBehavior() {
028        boolean simple = (getRawDevice() instanceof DcMotor);
029        if (simple) {
030            return "";
031        }
032        if (zeroBehavior == DcMotor.ZeroPowerBehavior.BRAKE) {
033            return "Brk";
034        } else {
035            return "Flt";
036        }
037    }
038
039    /**
040     * Create a motor
041     *
042     * @param device The hardware device
043     */
044    public Motor(T device, String nm) {
045        super(device, nm);
046        power = 0;
047        dir = DcMotorSimple.Direction.FORWARD;
048        zeroBehavior = DcMotor.ZeroPowerBehavior.FLOAT;
049    }
050
051    /**
052     * Create a motor
053     *
054     * @param deviceName The device name
055     */
056    public Motor(String deviceName) {
057        super(deviceName);
058    }
059
060    @Override
061    public String LogLine() {
062        if (min <= -1.0 && max >= 1.0) {
063            return logData(String.format("%1.2f%s%s", power, dirStr(), zBehavior()));
064        } else {
065            return logData(String.format("%1.2f%s%s[%1.2f-%1.2f]", power, dirStr(), zBehavior(), min, max));
066        }
067    }
068
069    /**
070     * Sets the min &amp; max values for the motor power (still clipped to -1/1)
071     *
072     * @param mi The minimum value
073     * @param ma The maximum value
074     * @return The Motor (for chaining)
075     */
076    public Motor<T> setLimits(double mi, double ma) {
077        mi = Range.clip(mi, -1, 1);
078        ma = Range.clip(ma, -1, 1);
079        min = Math.min(mi, ma);
080        max = Math.max(mi, ma);
081        return this;
082    }
083
084    /**
085     * Returns the DcMotorSimple.Direction the motor is traveling
086     */
087    public DcMotorSimple.Direction getDirection() {
088        T device = getRawDevice();
089        if (device != null) {
090            dir = device.getDirection();
091        }
092        return dir;
093    }
094
095    /**
096     * Set the motor to go *backward*
097     */
098    public Motor<T> setBackward() {
099        T device = getRawDevice();
100        if (device != null) {
101            device.setDirection(DcMotorSimple.Direction.REVERSE);
102        }
103        dir = DcMotorSimple.Direction.REVERSE;
104        return this;
105    }
106
107    /**
108     * Set the motor to go *forward*
109     */
110    public Motor<T> setForward() {
111        T device = getRawDevice();
112        if (device != null) {
113            device.setDirection(DcMotorSimple.Direction.FORWARD);
114        }
115        dir = DcMotorSimple.Direction.FORWARD;
116        return this;
117    }
118
119    /**
120     * Set the motor to go in a particular direction
121     */
122    public Motor<T> setDirection(DcMotorSimple.Direction dir) {
123        this.dir = dir;
124        T device = getRawDevice();
125        if (device != null) {
126            device.setDirection(dir);
127        }
128        return this;
129    }
130
131    /**
132     * Gets the power value for the motor
133     *
134     * @return the power value (as a double)
135     * @deprecated use getPower() instead
136     */
137    @Deprecated
138    public double getSpeed() {
139        return getPower();
140    }
141
142    /**
143     * Gets the power value for the motor
144     *
145     * @return the power value (as a double)
146     */
147    public double getPower() {
148        T device = getRawDevice();
149        if (device != null) {
150            power = device.getPower();
151        }
152        return power;
153    }
154
155    /**
156     * Set the (range-clipped) speed of motor
157     *
158     * @param speed The speed of the motor
159     * @deprecated Please use setPower instead
160     */
161    @Deprecated
162    public void setSpeed(double speed) {
163        setPower(speed);
164    }
165
166    /**
167     * Set the (range-clipped) power of the motor
168     *
169     * @param pow The power value (-1 -> 1)
170     */
171    public void setPower(double pow) {
172        power = Range.clip(pow, min, max);
173        T device = getRawDevice();
174        if (device != null) {
175            device.setPower(power);
176        }
177    }
178
179    /**
180     * Configure the motor to *brake* when the power is set to zero.
181     *
182     * @return The Motor device (for chaining)
183     */
184    public Motor<T> brake() {
185        T device = getRawDevice();
186        if (device instanceof DcMotor) {
187            ((DcMotor) device).setZeroPowerBehavior(DcMotor.ZeroPowerBehavior.BRAKE);
188        }
189        zeroBehavior = DcMotor.ZeroPowerBehavior.BRAKE;
190        return this;
191    }
192
193    /**
194     * Configure the motor to *float* when the power is set to zero.
195     *
196     * @return The Motor device (for chaining)
197     */
198    public Motor<T> coast() {
199        T device = getRawDevice();
200        if (device instanceof DcMotor) {
201            ((DcMotor) device).setZeroPowerBehavior(DcMotor.ZeroPowerBehavior.FLOAT);
202        }
203        zeroBehavior = DcMotor.ZeroPowerBehavior.FLOAT;
204        return this;
205    }
206
207    /**
208     * Gets the *speed* of the motor when it's used as a DoubleSupplier
209     *
210     * @return The speed of the motor
211     */
212    @Override
213    public Double get() {
214        return getPower();
215    }
216}
